title: The most realistic eclipse timelapse I've ever taken - Spring 2022 Lunar Eclipse HDR stack

media:group.media:title: The most realistic eclipse timelapse I've ever taken - Spring 2022 Lunar Eclipse HDR stack
media:group.media:description:
A real lunar eclipse is DARK - the red moon is super faint, and it doesn't illuminate the clouds around it the way the regular sunlit moon does. Using two cameras, a tracker, and a bit of math. I created a video that's hopefully closer to what the human eye sees than what any single auto-exposing camera would be able to manage.

There's a lot more info about the process in the full video: https://youtu.be/6R-iMmcQ5aI

Music in this video:
The Empty Moons of Jupiter by DivKid
